title: Hardhat Exceptions generated from an emit of a custom error will be missing line numbers for and error details.
body:
The test code is trying to capture a custom error in javascript:
```
      expect(
        await this.token.connect(this.deployer).claimMint(this.recipient.address, parseEther('100')),
      ).to.be.revertedWith('InvalidSignature("0xfc39486c750a6cd425dc41cc85f043e3fe29634868b5be6a5ad2e22c470e21b1")');
```

This is a custom error with a single param in solidity: 
```
error InvalidSignature(bytes32 signature);
...
revert InvalidSignature(mintHash);
```

The problem is that every time a custom error is generated via a `revert` hardhat looses track of what line number in the test case that generated the fault, and also looses track of what was returned and only lists what it was expecting to see.   When a revert is used, the developer needs the same level of error messages as other error types.

These are the error messages we are getting, none of them contain a link to the line in the test case that generated the fault or the mismatch:

  1) 
```
   Mother contract test
       mothercoin functions
         can mint coin as liquid - action:

      AssertionError: Expected transaction to be reverted
      + expected - actual

      -Transaction NOT reverted.
      +Transaction reverted.

```

`AssertionError: Expected transaction to be reverted with InvalidMintSigner`


   ```
  Error: VM Exception while processing transaction: reverted with custom error 'InvalidSignature("0xfc39486c750a6cd425dc41cc85f043e3fe29634868b5be6a5ad2e22c470e21b1")'
      at MotherCoin.onlySuper (contracts/MotherCoin.sol:125)
      at MotherCoin.claimMint (contracts/MotherCoin.sol:1040)
      at HardhatNode._mineBlockWithPendingTxs (node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/hardhat-network/provider/node.ts:1773:23)
      at HardhatNode.mineBlock (node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/hardhat-network/provider/node.ts:466:16)
      at EthModule._sendTransactionAndReturnHash (node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/hardhat-network/provider/modules/eth.ts:1504:18)
      at HardhatNetworkProvider.request (node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/hardhat-network/provider/provider.ts:118:18)
      at EthersProviderWrapper.send (node_modules/@nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers/src/internal/ethers-provider-wrapper.ts:13:20)
```

This issue is also being [tracked on Linear](https://linear.app/nomic-foundation/issue/HH-1098/hardhat-exceptions-generated-from-an-emit-of-a-custom-error-will-be).

We use Linear to manage our development process, but we keep the conversations on Github.

LINEAR-ID: cc61461e-04ed-4953-8749-1c9b62dcf64b

From the [hardhat docs](https://hardhat.org/hardhat-chai-matchers/docs/overview#why-would-i-want-to-use-it?): 
> Note that the await is required before an expect(...).to.emit(...), because the verification requires the retrieval of the event logs from the Ethereum node, which is an asynchronous operation. Without that initial await, your test may run to completion before the Ethereum transaction even completes.

The same happens with errors and reverts ([additional info](https://hardhat.org/hardhat-runner/docs/guides/test-contracts#testing-a-function-that-reverts)).

So, try this:
``` solidity
await expect(
        this.token.connect(this.deployer).claimMint(this.recipient.address, parseEther('100')),
      ).to.be.revertedWith('InvalidSignature("0xfc39486c750a6cd425dc41cc85f043e3fe29634868b5be6a5ad2e22c470e21b1")');
```
(add _await_ before _expect_   And  remove _await_ before _this.token_)

Changing the await order has no effect on hardhat's error message.

The bug is that hardhat's assertion error is missing information, such as the line number of the unit test and the expectation mismatch.   People on stack overflow are experiencing the same problem as I am:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/72240239/i-am-getting-assertionerror-expected-transaction-to-be-reverted-with-username

Every failed unit test should tell the developer which line of javascript failed, and what the mismatch is.  We have about 8 cases of the three error types listed  - none of which are telling us what is broken or how to fix it.  I believe this annoying bug in hardhat is because hardhat is failing to report the line number and the type of error emitted by a custom `revert`.  


> From the [hardhat docs](https://hardhat.org/hardhat-chai-matchers/docs/overview#why-would-i-want-to-use-it?):
> 
> > Note that the await is required before an expect(...).to.emit(...), because the verification requires the retrieval of the event logs from the Ethereum node, which is an asynchronous operation. Without that initial await, your test may run to completion before the Ethereum transaction even completes.
> 
> The same happens with errors and reverts ([additional info](https://hardhat.org/hardhat-runner/docs/guides/test-contracts#testing-a-function-that-reverts)).
> 
> So, try this:
> 
> ```solidity
> await expect(
>         this.token.connect(this.deployer).claimMint(this.recipient.address, parseEther('100')),
>       ).to.be.revertedWith('InvalidSignature("0xfc39486c750a6cd425dc41cc85f043e3fe29634868b5be6a5ad2e22c470e21b1")');
> ```
> 
> (add _await_ before _expect_ And remove _await_ before _this.token_)

Also await is required inside of the expect() if you are expecting to capture an emit. Changing this order shouldn't make the error message less useful, that still means this bug is annoying. 

`     TypeError: Cannot read property 'waitForTransaction' of undefined
      at Object.waitForPendingTransaction (node_modules/@ethereum-waffle/chai/dist/cjs/matchers/misc/transaction.js:18:21)
      at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:93:5)
      at runNextTicks (internal/process/task_queues.js:62:3)
      at listOnTimeout (internal/timers.js:523:9)
      at processTimers (internal/timers.js:497:7)
      at Context.<anonymous> (test/FLAKE/flakeTest.js:532:5)`

Throws the exception above:

`    await expect(this.token.connect(this.deployer).setTreasury(this.treasury.address)).to.emit(
      this.treasury.address,
      'TresurySet',
    );`

fix:

`    expect(await this.token.connect(this.deployer).setTreasury(this.treasury.address)).to.emit(
      this.treasury.address,
      'TresurySet',
    );`


Await is also needed inside for a to.equal():

`     AssertionError: expected Promise{<pending>} to equal +0
      at Context.<anonymous> (test/FLAKE/flakeTest.js:537:71)
      at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:93:5)
      at runNextTicks (internal/process/task_queues.js:62:3)
      at listOnTimeout (internal/timers.js:523:9)
      at processTimers (internal/timers.js:497:7)
`
causes error above:

`await expect(this.token.getMintTime(keccak256(packedMessage))).to.equal(0);`

fix:
`expect(await this.token.getMintTime(keccak256(packedMessage))).to.equal(0);`
@TheRook which version of `hardhat-chai-matchers` are you using? We recently improved the async stack traces, but maybe there's more room for improvement.

I am using the one that comes with "hardhat": "^2.9.3", I'm not sure how to
be more specific.

On Sat, Aug 27, 2022 at 9:36 AM Franco Victorio ***@***.***>
wrote:

> @TheRook <https://github.com/TheRook> which version of
> hardhat-chai-matchers are you using? We recently improved the async stack
> traces, but maybe there's more room for improvement.
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/NomicFoundation/hardhat/issues/3085#issuecomment-1229223976>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAD7MN6HFFC52CWXUE7DOB3V3I7YVANCNFSM57YNAJ2A>
> .
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

I found the bug in master:
https://github.com/NomicFoundation/hardhat/blob/master/packages/hardhat-chai-matchers/src/internal/emit.ts#L66-L77


> @TheRook which version of `hardhat-chai-matchers` are you using? We recently improved the async stack traces, but maybe there's more room for improvement.

          `Expected event "${eventName}" to be emitted, but it wasn't`,
          `Expected event "${eventName}" NOT to be emitted, but it was`

It looks like when the value type is a custom error, it doesn't print the error.  "but it wasn't" is the bug - it wasn't what?  Well the real return value is never pulled out of the log on line 66 ^.   Also I am no seeing code that records the line number of the test that triggered this event mismatch.

> I am using the one that comes with "hardhat": "^2.9.3", I'm not sure how to be more specific.

Check the version with `npm ls @nomicfoundation/hardhat-chai-matchers`

> It looks like when the value type is a custom error, it doesn't print the error. "but it wasn't" is the bug - it wasn't what? Well the real return value is never pulled out of the log on line 66 ^. Also I am no seeing code that records the line number of the test that triggered this event mismatch.

I don't understand what you mean here. What that message is saying is that you were expecting some event (say, `Foo`) to be emitted, but that event was not emitted in that transaction. Maybe it would be clearer if we said "but it wasn't _emitted_"? Also, maybe we could show the list of emitted events?

But this issue is about the line numbers, so if you think that error message can be improved, please open a separate issue.

> fvictorio

This bug is real **bad** my friend, I think I have wasted probably 8-10+ hours on this one bug because it occurred a number times, it happens every time the script issues a `revert CustomEvent(args)` which is a new feature of Solidity that causes hardhat to behave poorly.   This issue is two fold, on one had when this type of issue occurs the line number of the test is completely and totally lost - you just get a puzzling error message with no hope of being able to find what line caused it - which is why we are seeing people encounter this bug on StackOverflow - because hardhat is handing out errors that is confusing the user base.

Part two is even worse.  So with part two of the bug,  supportEmit() in emits.ts disregards events emitted by revert() - for some reason it is treating these two types differently when one overrules the other.  If a supported emit doesn't hit - then it needs to return the last item in the log or the last error - saying "The test didn't see the event you were looking for, instead the transaction was reverted with _____ this happened on line XXX".  The unit log output is missing this mismatch - which I think is resolved by returning the very last item in the log in the error message.  Even if there isn't revert - saying "We didn't get this emit, function returned with '0'" - would be better than "Yo shits fucked, idk where - deal with it."  which is the current error message.

emits.ts isn't the only one that barfs when it is expecting one outcome and instead there is a revert, which  is a bug in hardhat that won't express its self if don't use this feature of the language.  If you are expecting something, and nothing else exists - but there is a `revert Anything()` then the unit test should report back that the contract is reverting and why.  Instead, the revert message is lost and we don't even get a line number of the test that is stuck - which gives every developer a really really big frown face :(
Closing this since I don't think there's much we can do, and I already opened separate issues (#3091, #3092) for the problems I mentioned.

How am I supposed to fix this? Or even figure out whats wrong?  Ok, but there is likely an event being triggered, its very likely Reverting on something, but there is no way to know and investigating this one issue will take hours because the error message baffling, it doesn't even tell me what is happening in Solidity OR in hardhat. 


```
  2) Contract: FlakeCoin ERC20
       _transfer
         when the recipient is not the zero address
           when the sender transfers all balance
             emits a transfer event:

      No 'Transfer' events found
      + expected - actual

      -false
      +true
      
      at inLogs (node_modules/@openzeppelin/test-helpers/src/expectEvent.js:51:32)
      at expectEvent (node_modules/@openzeppelin/test-helpers/src/expectEvent.js:29:12)
      at Context.<anonymous> (test/ERC20/ERC20.behavior.js:210:9)
      at runMicrotasks (<anonymous>)
      at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:93:5)
```

> These error messages are so bad, I dread using your software.

Well, I was willing to help you a bit more but you lost me there. Please learn to act like a decent human being and then open a new issue.
